dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Kazakhstan's aging index just hit 31.1 this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Kazakhstan's aging index just hit thirty one point one this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In 2024, the aging index reached 31.1, up from 29.5 in 2023.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, that's up from 29.5, right? A 1.6 point jump in just one year—that's pretty significant.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, that's up from twenty nine point five, right? A one point six point jump in just one year-that's pretty significant.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan's aging index has increased by 1.6 percentage points over the past year, according to data from the Bureau of National Statistics. In 2024, the aging index reached 31.1, up from 29.5 in 2023.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it means for every 100 kids under 15, there are now over 31 people aged 65 and above.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it means for every one hundred kids under fifteen, there are now over thirty one people aged sixty five and above.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This means there are 31.1 people aged 65 and over for every 100 children aged 0 to 15 in the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's uh, a pretty stark ratio when you think about it. But the regional differences are wild—North Kazakhstan is at 78.1!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's uh, a pretty stark ratio when you think about it. But the regional differences are wild-North Kazakhstan is at seventy eight point one!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Regionally, the highest aging index was recorded in the North Kazakhstan region at 78.1, followed by the East Kazakhstan region(76) and the Kostanay region (66.4).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Almost 80 elderly per 100 children? That's… intense. Meanwhile, Mangystau is down at 15.2.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Almost eighty elderly per one hundred children? That's... intense. Meanwhile, Mangystau is down at fifteen point two.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The lowest index was observed in the Mangystau region, where there are 15.2 elderly people per 100 children.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so it's not uniform at all. Urban areas are higher too—33.4 versus rural at 27.5.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so it's not uniform at all. Urban areas are higher toominus thirty three point four versus rural at twenty seven point five.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The aging index is higher in urban areas than in rural ones " 33.4 compared to 27.5, respectively.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Makes sense, younger families might be moving to cities for work, but older populations stay put?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Makes sense, younger families might be moving to cities for work, but older populations stay put?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Or maybe younger people are leaving some regions entirely, like in the north. East Kazakhstan is also high, like 76.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or maybe younger people are leaving some regions entirely, like in the north. East Kazakhstan is also high, like seventy six.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Regionally, the highest aging index was recorded in the North Kazakhstan region at 78.1, followed by the East Kazakhstan region(76) and the Kostanay region (66.4).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then you've got Turkestan and Shymkent with numbers in the mid-teens—totally different story.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then you've got Turkestan and Shymkent with numbers in the mid-teens-totally different story.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Other regions with low values include the Turkestan Region (15.9) and the city of Shymkent (16.1).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's like two different countries demographically, honestly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's like two different countries demographically, honestly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and this aging index is such a clear way to visualize the pressure on social systems, pensions, healthcare…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and this aging index is such a clear way to visualize the pressure on social systems, pensions, healthcare...

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. When you see North Kazakhstan's number, you can just imagine the strain.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. When you see North Kazakhstan's number, you can just imagine the strain.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Plus, the overall trend is upward—this isn't slowing down.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus, the overall trend is upward-this isn't slowing down.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan's aging index has increased by 1.6 percentage points over the past year, according to data from the Bureau of National Statistics.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: No, and with population data just updated to March 2025, it's only going to keep shaping policy debates.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, and with population data just updated to March twenty twenty five, it's only going to keep shaping policy debates.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Previously, the Bureau of National Statistics announced the population of Kazakhstan as of March 1, 2025.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It's one of those dry stats that tells a huge story.
